str2: A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
Opinion, counsel, judgment, intention, decree. From ginosko; cognition, i.e. opinion, or resolve.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.
To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
